page.title: 17Entertainment in a Local Pub
page.content: In public houses children are not allowed inside but outside there are seats and swings for the children. Inside for the over eighteens there are snooker and pool tables, plus they play dominoes ,darts and cards but all this is limited to one room. It is called the "Tap Room". In other rooms the people entertain themselves by talking or dancing to the juke box. A juke box is a musical box where you press a button and it plays the song you want. Also people play bandits for enjoyment. Sometimes the owner of the pub will organise a trip for men to go fishing or day trips to Bridlington or Scarborough. Some public houses have football teams. If they win they have parties and the mistress of the house makes some food.
